chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin T Wills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of Plea & Sentencing hearing held on September 24, 2018, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Karen Blair - Court Reporter

11:12 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 in 2016CF41 with no repeater and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in; will plea to count 1 in 2016CF123 with no repeater and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in; defendant will plea to count 1 in 2017CF8 with the repeater and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in; defendant will plea to counts 2,3 & 4 without the repeaters in 2018CF26 and orders the balance of the counts and 2017CM39 & 2018CF56 be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Atty Privat concurs, and defendant is in agreement with the costs on the soberlink.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by the Court.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2016CF41 striking the repeater and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in; Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 on 2016CF123, striking the alcohol fine enhancer and repeater and orders count 2 be dismissed outright and counts 3,4 & 5 be dismissed and read-in; Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2017CF8 with the the repeater and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in;  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2,3 & 4 striking the repeaters and orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders 2017CM39 & 2018CF56 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF41 (Count 1)

-75 days county jail, concurrent to any other sentence.  Court grants the defendant 10 days of sentence.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CF123 (Count 1)

-75 days county jail, concurrent to any other sentence.  Court grants the defendant 4 days of sentence credit.
-$600 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DL revocation - 30 months
-IID - 30 months
-AODA(GL)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2017CF8 (Count 1)

-41 months of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision, concurrent to any other sentence.  Court grants the defendant 227 days of sentence credit.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $938.95.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2018CF26 (EACH) - Count 2,3 & 4

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years, consecutive to the prison sentence on 2017CF8.  Court grants the defendant 243 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
-Restitution - $2,200. Restitution to be paid to the probation office.  
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court orders the sentence to commence immediately.
-Court orders any cash bonds on file be applied first to the restitution, then to the soberlink and then to the fines and court costs.

-Court finds the defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Earned Release Program.

Court adjourned at 11:37 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 24, 2018 at 11:00 am.
